meanings.definition: To squat close to the ground or with the knees bent.
meanings.sent1: I like to hunker down when playing hide and seek.
meanings.sent2: The child decided to hunker on the floor to look under the bed.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to hunker in the tiny box, looking quite silly.
meanings.sent4: She had to hunker like a frog to fit under the low branch.
meanings.sent5: Remember to hunker low to the ground to avoid being seen.

meanings.definition: To settle in or dig in for a sustained period of time.
meanings.sent1: During the storm, we had to hunker inside the house for safety.
meanings.sent2: The explorer had to hunker in the cave until the blizzard passed.
meanings.sent3: The family decided to hunker in the living room for a movie marathon.
meanings.sent4: She had to hunker in the library to finish her research paper.
meanings.sent5: The soldiers had to hunker in the trenches during the battle.
